newsitem.title: USA: US Midco spot prods off with NYMEX, but diffs firm.
newsitem.headline: US Midco spot prods off with NYMEX, but diffs firm.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent spot product prices were sharply lower around midday Friday, especially in the case of gasoline as NYMEX product futures headed downward, traders said.

But differentials were firm, particularly in the case of "1-oil" or "Y-grade" low sulphur jet fuel, which in Group Three have soared to 10 cents over "X-grade" or low sulphur diesel by dint of the cold snap gripping the midcontinent.
"Y-grade is just flying," said one trader, noting just a week ago, he closed a deal for 50,000 barrels of Y-grade at 4.25 cents over prompt Group Three low sulphur diesel.
Low sulphur jet fuel is mixed with diesel in cold temperatures to prevent the motor fuel from becoming too gummy to burn properly.

Group Three low sulphur diffs perked up a bit amid talk some players were interested in closing a few deals before the weekend, with prompt and any month barrels talked from 6.50 to 7.00 cents under January NYMEX, the latter a done deal.

Diffs in Chicago were a bit more stable, with unleaded gasoline talked at around 5.50 cents under the January print, and prompt and low sulphur diesel diesel pegged about unchanged at 8.00 under NYMEX.
-- Oliver Ludwig New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1633
